name: Ocimum canum
Relationship: Compare: BERB.; HEDEOMA; LYCOP.; PAREIR.; URTICA.

Urine: High acidity, formation of spike crystals of uric acid
Turbid, thick, purulent, bloody; brick-dust red or yellow sediment
Female: Vulva swollen; darting pain in labia
Breasts fell full and tense; itching
Male: Heat and swelling of left testicle

details: Is to be remembered in diseases of the kidneys, bladder and urethra. Uric acid diathesis. Red sand in the urine is its chief characteristic, and frequently verified. Swelling of glands, inguinal and mammary. Renal colic, especially right side. Symptoms of renal calculus are pronounced. Uric acid diathesis, pain in ureters.
